The VP method creates an VolumeProfile indicator, sets up a consolidator to update the indicator, and then returns the indicator so you can use it in your algorithm.

The following reference table describes the VP method:

VP()1/1

            VolumeProfile QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.VP (
    Symbol                            symbol,
    *Int32                            period,
    *Decimal                          valueAreaVolumePercentage,
    *Decimal                          priceRangeRoundOff,
    *Resolution                       resolution,
    *Func<IBaseData, TradeBar>  selector
   )

Creates an Market Profile indicator for the symbol with Volume Profile (VOL) mode. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol whose VP we want.
*Int32 period (Optional) The period of the VP.
*Decimal valueAreaVolumePercentage (Optional) The percentage of volume contained in the value area.
*Decimal priceRangeRoundOff (Optional) How many digits you want to round and the precision. i.e 0.01 round to two digits exactly.
*Resolution resolution (Optional) The resolution.
*Func<IBaseData, TradeBar> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData to send into the indicator, if None defaults to the Value property of BaseData (x => x.Value).

Return

VolumeProfile - The Volume Profile indicator for the given parameters

Definition at line 1136 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.


If you don't provide a resolution, it defauls to the security resolution. If you provide a resolution, it must be greater than or equal to the resolution of the security. For instance, if you subscribe to hourly data for a security, you should update its indicator with data that spans 1 hour or longer.

For more information about the selector argument, see Alternative Price Fields.
